title: Citizenship, Religion, and Religious Minorities in Modern Europe
description: This course aims to explore the subject of religion and religious minorities in the making of citizenship in modern Europe, a topic which scholars have long relegated to the margins. The course aims to pose questions and challenge conventional wisdom rather than to provide definitive answers. The course begins with some broad readings to establish the multiple notions and discourses of citizenship. The first unit focuses on âtolerationâ and legal statuses in early modern Europe. The second unit considers the role of religion in notions of âequalityâ and âcitizenshipâ in the period 1780-1870. The third unit will consider the place of religious minorities from the mid-nineteenth century to the post WWI period as they were transformed into ânational minorities.â The course will focus on Western and Central Europe.
